radiographic_examinations.findings: Bibasilar consolidations, greater on the right, with significant associated right pulmonary volume loss and chronic elevation of the right hemidiaphragm. Moderate hepatic steatosis. No intra or extrahepatic biliary duct dilation. Common bile duct measures 3 mm. Gallbladder surgically absent. Mild stranding and trace fluid in the gallbladder fossa. Normal pancreas, spleen, kidneys, adrenal glands, gastrointestinal tract, and abdominal vasculature. Mild multilevel degenerative changes in the spine.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Consolidations are new from the prior exam.
